item.description:
The Wildlands Trust in cooperation with the Department of Conservation and Recreation and Bayside Runner is hosting a Run for Conservation in Myles Standish State Forest on Saturday, August 6, and they have invited us to help!

Altogether, about 50 volunteers are needed to help with parking, registering participants, directing traffic and runners, handing out water and passing out orange slices for the 5K run/walk for the environment.

A time commitment of approximately 3 hours is being suggested to allow for everything from setup through the award ceremony to clean up for the big event.  Volunteers will be asked to arrive by 8:30 am to prepare for the race which is estimated to take about an hour and a half.

A meeting will be scheduled prior to race day by Wildlands Trust organizer Sarah Kugel to assign volunteer positions and give out race T-shirts to identify volunteers on race day.

Funds raised by the racers or donated to the event will be used to preserve open space in Southeastern MA and support the work of the Wildlands Trust.

 

Anyone interested in taking part in the race can go to the race website at http://www.wildlandstrust.org/GetInvolved/RunforConservation/tabid/259/Default.aspx
item.how_to_find_us: Follow Upper College Pond Road to Fearing Pond Road to Charge Pond Road.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Volunteer for the Environment
